title: Technical Writing and Process Description
description: Grammatical structures for describing technical processes and systems

sections.title: Process Description Structures
sections.explanation: Grammatical patterns for explaining how systems and processes work.

patterns.example: Data is collected from multiple sensors, processed in real-time, and transmitted to the central server.
patterns.note: Agent is often omitted when the process itself is the focus

patterns.example: Initially, the user submits credentials. Subsequently, the system validates them against the database.
If authentication succeeds, the user is granted access; otherwise, the system requests re-entry.
The algorithm analyzes patterns and generates recommendations based on user behavior.
patterns.note: Use present simple for describing how systems generally work

sections.title: Describing System Components
sections.explanation: Structures for explaining parts and their relationships.

patterns.structure: The system consists of/comprises/is made up of X, Y, and Z
patterns.example: The platform consists of three main components: the user interface, the processing engine, and the database layer.

patterns.structure: X serves to/functions to/is designed to + infinitive
patterns.example: The cache serves to reduce database load by storing frequently accessed data.

patterns.structure: X communicates with/interfaces with/connects to Y
patterns.example: The API interfaces with external services to retrieve real-time data.

sections.title: Expressing Technical Possibility and Capability
sections.explanation: Modal expressions for describing system capabilities.

distinctions.example: The system can process up to 10,000 requests per second.

distinctions.meaning: What the system makes possible for users
distinctions.example: The interface enables users to customize their dashboards.

distinctions.meaning: Compatible with or provides functionality for
distinctions.example: The platform supports multiple authentication methods.
The AI is capable of processing natural language queries.

sections.title: Hedging in Technical Communication
sections.explanation: Expressing uncertainty and limitations in technical writing.

techniques.example: The algorithm typically achieves 95% accuracy under optimal conditions.
Performance is limited to scenarios with sufficient training data.

exercises.original: The system administrator configures the firewall and the firewall blocks unauthorized access.
exercises.answer: The firewall is configured (by the system administrator) and unauthorized access is blocked.
The load balancer distributes incoming traffic across multiple servers to ensure optimal resource utilization and prevent any single server from becoming overwhelmed.
